summary: This document is a lengthy, emotionally charged email chain from an alleged Epstein victim, dated April 2025, addressed to various media figures, politicians, and investigators. The sender makes numerous accusations of evidence tampering, financial misconduct by attorneys, witness intimidation, and cover-ups related to the Epstein case. It references Prince Andrew, financial settlements, media ethics, and calls for investigations into numerous individuals and organizations.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned in relation to sex abuse allegations and testimony from an alleged victim. The sender references a victim's testimony about being trafficked to him.

persons.name: Gayle King
persons.context: Addressed directly in accusatory tones regarding media coverage, interviews with victims, and alleged suppression of information.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Repeatedly addressed as "Mr President" or "President Trump," with requests to investigate individuals like Rishi Sunak, media outlets, and to provide assistance to the sender.

persons.name: Rishi Sunak
persons.context: Accused of having emails deleted and called for investigation regarding his financials and involvement.

persons.name: Kash Patel
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as the person who should be investigating the claims, taking witness statements, and examining evidence. Referred to as being appointed by Trump.

persons.name: Alina Habba
persons.context: Identified as President Trump's attorney. The sender repeatedly asks for evidence to be sent to her and for her to be involved in investigations.

persons.name: Keir Starmer
persons.context: Accused of profiting from the Epstein case and asked why he hasn't acknowledged the UK's role. Also criticized for not arresting the sender.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as a convicted facilitator of Epstein's trafficking ring and as being present on the island.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Accused of providing legal services to Prince Andrew and the Royal Family while being a named defendant, which the sender claims is illegal. Also accused of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Described as the "biggest distributor of Eastern European girls" for sex trafficking to the UK. His modeling agencies in Ukraine are mentioned.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Former JP Morgan and Barclays executive. The email references an FCA investigation into his statements about his relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Adam Castellani
persons.context: Repeatedly named, with photos referenced. Implicated as a colleague of Jes Staley at JP Morgan and involved in the trafficking ring. The sender claims photos of him were deleted from her devices.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: Accused of having a friendship with Epstein and meeting with him. The sender claims to have sold pictures of Mandelson with Epstein to the Daily Mail.

persons.name: Rupert Murdoch
persons.context: Accused of perverting the course of justice and called for investigation alongside his son Lachlan.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.context: Co-founder of Google. Accused of being on Epstein's island and having specific sexual interests. The sender demands he be questioned.

persons.name: Jamie Dimon
persons.context: CEO of JP Morgan. Accused of being a "monster," funding Epstein's trafficking for decades, and illegally deleting emails.

persons.name: Cyril Ramaphosa
persons.context: Accused of being involved in trafficking girls out of South Africa and protecting other individuals. The sender demands he be investigated.

persons.name: Emmanuel Macron
persons.context: Asked why French authorities never arrested Epstein. The sender demands France be held accountable and pay compensation.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of an attorney being friends with him and Hillary Clinton, creating a alleged conflict of interest in representing Epstein victims.

persons.name: Lesley Groff
persons.context: Named as a long-term employee of the Epstein trafficking ring. The sender references emails from her.

connections.description: The sender alleges Dershowitz provided legal services to Prince Andrew and the Royal Family, which is claimed to be illegal under the circumstances of an ongoing criminal investigation.
Described as colleagues at JP Morgan at the same time, both implicated in the Epstein network.
The sender implies Murdoch profited from or covered up Brunel's trafficking activities, specifically the distribution of Eastern European girls.
The sender claims to have been represented by these attorneys who then allegedly silenced her, mishandled her settlement, and profited from victims.
The sender claims this witness helped traffic her and was connected to Ramaphosa, implying his knowledge or involvement in trafficking out of South Africa.
The sender claims to have sold pictures of Mandelson with Epstein to the Daily Mail and references multiple meetings between them.

events.title: Threatening Email Sent
events.description: The sender composes and sends a lengthy, accusatory email to numerous recipients, threatening legal action and exposure, using the phrase "Run rabbit run."

events.title: Emotional WhatsApp Exchange Between Victims
events.description: A referenced WhatsApp message from October 18, 2022, shows two alleged victims consoling each other, discussing financial hardship, depression, and the trauma of the Epstein case.

events.title: US Open Trip with Epstein Associates
events.description: The sender references being taken to the US Open by Ghislaine Maxwell and other victims on August 27, 2019, and sitting next to a Daily Beast journalist at dinner.

events.title: Alleged Time with Epstein and Associates
events.description: The sender references spending Christmas Day 2006 in Jeffrey Epstein's apartment cooking for a friend. Also mentions meeting Sergey Brin with Epstein in January 2007.

events.title: Report to UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)
events.description: The sender details submitting a complaint and evidence to the UK FCA regarding Jes Staley, Adam Castellani, Peter Mandelson, and others, alleging financial crime and obstruction of justice related to Epstein.

locations: Hout Bay, South Africa (referenced as where a witness bought a house)
Ukraine (referenced for modeling agencies set up by Jean Luc Brunel)
Australia (mentioned in context of tariffs and a bus accident story)
keyFacts: The sender, an alleged Epstein victim, claims her electronic evidence (emails, photos) has been repeatedly deleted or encrypted from her devices by unknown parties.
She alleges a massive conflict of interest and profiteering by attorneys representing Epstein victims, claiming they made hundreds of millions while silencing victims and protecting perpetrators.

The email accuses multiple media outlets (Guardian, Sky News, Daily Mail, NY Times, CBS) and journalists of perverting the course of justice, suppressing information, and profiting from the Epstein story.

It references a specific alleged victim's settlement being rolled into a fund controlled by her attorney, forcing her to beg for monthly payments, which the sender claims could invalidate her testimony.

The correspondence calls for international investigations and arrests of numerous world leaders and figures, including Cyril Ramaphosa, Emmanuel Macron, Rishi Sunak, and Keir Starmer, for alleged involvement or cover-ups.
